qas.question: An inclined plane with a conveyor belt describes what type of elevator?
What do the partians do on the conveyor?

answers.text: ensure that the material moves forward

qas.question: What industries are these types of elevators generally used in?
What are spiral screws used for?

answers.text: to elevate grain for storage in large vertical silos

qas.question: What type of elevators are used for loading loose materials into bulk carriers?

context: <a0_0>Material transport elevators<a0_0/> generally consist of an inclined plane on which a conveyor belt runs. The conveyor often includes partitions to <a1_0>ensure that the material moves forward<a1_0/>. These elevators are often used in <a2_0>industrial and agricultural applications<a2_0/>. When such mechanisms (or spiral screws or pneumatic transport) are used <a3_0>to elevate grain for storage in large vertical silos<a3_0/>, the entire structure is called a grain elevator. <a4_0>Belt elevators<a4_0/> are often used in docks for loading loose materials such as coal, iron ore and grain into the holds of bulk carriers
